descriptions.content:
E-conferencing tools faciliate people meeting together to hold a conference of a few people to may people over the web despite being at different locations. Typical features of such systems include:

  • Talk via audio delivered over the web and/or through separate phone calls
  • See video of participants
  • Separate chat window for textual exchanges, including capacity to make private messages to just one other participant for private side discussions
  • Share one computer screen with all other participants, including allowing any other participant to "take over" the screen of another with his/her mouse
  • Record the entire session, including computer screen along with the audio of poeple's comments, to make a screencast to be consult later, or share with others who could not be at the meeting
